intro: Henckelia woodii, commonly known as the Wood's henckelia, is a rare and critically endangered plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology includes a compact growth habit and distinctive leaf patterns. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
